column1: Table 6.1 Bladder stones classified by aetiology

column2: Occur in the absence   of other urinary tract   pathology, typically in   children in areas with   poor hydration, recurrent   diarrhoea, and a diet   deficient in animal protein
column4: Form in the upper urinary   tract, then passed into   the bladder where they   may be a nidus for stone   growth
